business.headline: Government to relax lending, rethink quality checks to boost exportersA senior government source said that the new support could include relaxed bank lending rules, better working capital access, and a review of strict quality checks that have been slowing down supply chains.

ITR mistakes to be fixed faster? Here's how CBDT's new rules can speed up refundsTaxpayers who've faced delays due to errors in their income tax returns may soon breathe easier. The CBDT has introduced new rules aimed at correcting ITR mistakes faster and speeding up refunds.

Lenskart shares list at 3% discount: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 395 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), lower than the issue price of Rs 402. On the BSE, it listed at Rs 390, marking a discount of 2.98%.

Why Sebi is warning investors about digital gold and what makes Gold ETFs saferSebi has warned investors about digital gold sold by fintech apps, calling it unregulated and risky. Experts say investors should move to Gold ETFs and other Sebi-regulated options for safety.

Lenskart shares make dull market debut, lists at 3% below IPO priceLenskart shares made a quiet market debut on Dalal Street today, opening at Rs 390 on the BSE, down 2.98% from the issue price. On the NSE, the stock began trading at Rs 395 per share, slightly below its issue price of Rs 402.

Sebi warns against digital gold: How risky is it and should you invest?Digital gold, often marketed as a convenient way to buy small amounts of gold online, allows users to purchase, store, and sell gold through apps without ever holding it physically.

Groww IPO allotment out today: Check status, latest GMP and listing detailsThe Groww IPO allotment is out today with investors checking status online. Strong demand met with moderate grey market premium as listing gains expected to stay limited amid market volatility.

Goldman Sachs upgrades India to overweight, expects Nifty to rally to 29,000The brokerage has now set a Nifty50 target of 29,000 by December 2026, suggesting a potential upside of about 14% from Friday's closing levels.

Sensex, Nifty rise in choppy trade as investors pin hopes on strong Q2 earningsAt 9:30 am, the Sensex was up 136 points or 0.16% at 83,352.68, while the Nifty gained 37.7 points or 0.15% to 25,530.00.

Are all digital gold investments at risk after Sebi's warning?Sebi made it clear that while some gold investment options are covered under its rules, many digital gold products operate outside its supervision and can expose investors to serious risks.

Lenskart IPO listing today: Will the shares make a strong market debut?Lenskart's IPO opened on October 31 and closed on November 4, receiving an overwhelming response from investors. The issue was subscribed 28.27 times overall.

Will gold continue to glitter this wedding season?Gold has always been the heart of Indian wedding traditions, but surging prices and evolving tastes are forcing families to rethink their buying strategy. As the wedding season peaks, one question rings loud — will gold still shine bright, and should you buy now or wait?

Thinking of buying digital gold? Sebi warns it's not a regulated productSebi further clarified that investor protection mechanisms applicable to regulated securities will not extend to such unregulated digital gold schemes.

Musk to pocket $1,000,000,000,000. What will he do with all the money?Elon Musk has been one of the world's richest people for several years now. And a $1 trillion pay package, which comes with conditions, will only make him richer. It has led social media to wonder how Musk, who is known not to live an extravagant life, will spend his money.

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Gold vs real estate: Where should you invest?Safe glitter or solid bricks? Investors have always loved gold and property, but choosing between the two can be tricky. With inflation, demand, and prices on the rise, it's time to ask—where you should put your money.

Adani Power bags Bhagalpur's 2,400 MW project tenderFour qualified bidders participated in the tender, with Adani Power quoting the lowest electricity tariff of Rs 6.075 per kWh (or per unit), sources with direct knowledge of the bidding process said.

Gold trades at around Rs 1.21 lakh per 10 grams: Should you buy or wait?Gold's shine shows no sign of fading as global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and festive demand keep prices high. But should investors buy now or wait for the next dip?
Sensex, Nifty end week in red amid weak global cues and FII sellingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 94.73 points to end at 83,216.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.40 points to close at 25,492.30.

BSE share price jumps nearly 9% despite market slump. Here's what drove the rallyAt the end of the trading session on November 7, BSE shares closed 8.61% higher at Rs 2,666.90 apiece on the NSE, bucking the overall market trend.

entertainment.headline: Ananya Panday dances her heart out at friend's Udaipur wedding, video goes viral Ananya Panday lit up her friend Deeya Shroff's Udaipur wedding with her energetic dance moves, as a video of her grooving to 'Woh Lamhe' went viral. Her photo dump from the festivities also grabbed attention after Janhvi Kapoor's playful comment on a picture of Ananya twinning with Shikhar Pahariya.

Would Robert Pattinson ever return as Edward Cullen in Twilight? Actor responds Actor Robert Pattinson has signalled a willingness to reprise his iconic Edward Cullen role from 'The Twilight Saga'. During a recent interview, the actor jokingly said he wants to be 17 again.

Renuka Shahane has three words for Aishwarya Rai's body-shamers: Shut your mouth Renuka Shahane stood up against the body-shaming faced by Aishwarya Rai following her post-pregnancy appearances at events, highlighting ongoing pressures on female actors in the industry.

Vijay's son Jason Sanjay's Sigma first-look poster out, shooting nears completion The first-look poster of Thalapathy Vijay's son, Jason Sanjay's debut directorial, 'Sigma', was launched on November 10. Nearly 95 per cent of the shooting has been completed.

Bummed to be missing out: KJo regrets not being at Scorsese's Homebound screening Karan Johar shared his excitement after the screening of India's Oscar entry 'Homebound' in New York, an event hosted by celebrated filmmaker Martin Scorsese.

Lee Tamahori, director of Once Were Warriors and Die Another Day, dies at 75 Lee Tamahori, acclaimed for his films spanning both Hollywood and New Zealand cinema, has died at 75 following a struggle with Parkinson's disease. His legacy includes a commitment to promoting Maori talent and a significant impact on filmmakers worldwide.

I've heard beautiful stories: Maxton Hall 2's Damian Hardung on visiting India Actor Damian Hardung discusses his role in 'Maxton Hall Season 2' and his memories of India. He reflects on his character's vulnerability and shares his spiritual ties to the country.

All Her Fault review: Parenthood, paranoia and pain collide in this tense thrillerRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025 'All Her Fault' is a haunting domestic thriller that explores the fears, guilt and fragility of modern motherhood through a child's mysterious disappearance. Anchored by powerful performances, it's a slow-burn story that exposes the emotional cost of being a working mother.

Bigg Boss Tamil 7 highlights: Praveen Raj evicted, Sandra's secret task revealed Praveen Raj was evicted unexpectedly from Bigg Boss Tamil 7 on Sunday. Sandra's secret task success sparked praise and stirred emotions among contestants.

HAQ box office Day 3: Yami Gautam's film steady after 1st weekend Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's courtroom drama 'HAQ', based on the landmark Shah Bano Begum case, earned Rs 8.85 crore in India during its first weekend.

Dear X review: Kim Yoo-jung excels in dark psychological thrillerRelease Date:Thu Nov 06, 2025 'Dear X' is a gripping psychological thriller showcasing Kim Yoo-jung's chilling performance. The show's unrelenting darkness challenges viewers seeking emotional connection.

Celina Jaitly prays for brother detained in UAE: Haven't slept a single night Former actor Celina Jaitly shared an emotional note for her brother, Major Vikrant Kumar Jaitly, who has allegedly been detained in the UAE for almost a year. In her note, Jaitly prayed for her brother's well-being.

KJo on why Virat Kohli hasn't appeared on Koffee With Karan: No cricketers now Filmmaker Karan Johar recently discussed why cricketer Virat Kohli has never appeared on his popular talk show 'Koffee with Karan'. He reflected on the aftermath of a previous controversy involving Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul.

Prithviraj, Vivek Oberoi's warm exchange about SSMB 29, Spirit sparks anticipation Vivek Oberoi and Prithviraj Sukumaran exchanged words of appreciation on social media following the reveal of Prithviraj's look as Kumbha in SS Rajamouli's upcoming film, with Prithviraj expressing his excitement for Oberoi's role in 'Spirit'.

Tamil film body proposes revenue-sharing for star films, sets OTT release windows The Tamil Film Producers Council has introduced a new revenue-sharing model for big-budget films and implemented additional rules for film releases and industry practices, following decisions at its general body meeting in Chennai.

Team Logan Dean or Jess? Matt Czuchry and Jared Padalecki pick their favourites Actors Matt Czuchry and Jared Padalecki reunite to discuss their experiences on 'Gilmore Girls', the enduring impact of the show, and their perspectives on the ongoing debate surrounding Rory's boyfriends, sharing insights and stories from their time on set.

Bigg Boss Malayalam 7: How Anumol braved PR controversies to win Mohanlal's show The seventh season of Bigg Boss Malayalam ended with notable milestones, including the victory of Anumol and the unprecedented entry of a commoner into the final round. The season drew attention for its diverse contestant pool, tougher tasks, and external PR activity aimed at swaying public opinion.

How Elle Fanning's Thia turns Predator: Badlands into a feminist win Hollywood star, Elle Fanning's Thia in 'Predator: Badlands' brings a fresh feminist twist to the male-centric action-sci-fi franchise, proving that brains, strategy, and silent power can outshine brute force.

Max B reunites with rapper French Montana after 16 years in prison. Watch Harlem rapper Max B has been released from prison after serving 16 years, reuniting with his family, friends, and fellow artist French Montana. The release has generated significant attention, with fans and supporters reacting to the news.

People against tariffs are fools: Trump announces $2,000 dividend for AmericansTrump claimed the country is taking in trillions of dollars from tariffs, with the money set to be used to reduce the $37 trillion national debt. He said the administration would soon begin paying it down while issuing a dividend of at least $2,000 per person.

US Senate votes on key measure to end 40-day government shutdown amid riftOn Sunday night, the Senate voted 60-40 on the key procedural measure following an agreement between a group of moderate Democrats, Republican leaders, and the White House to advance the plan, even without a guaranteed extension of health care subsidies -- a decision that has sparked a rift among some Democrats.

The next wave of layoffs might not be in offices but on the streetsDrones are being used for deliveries in Gurgaon and Bengaluru. Amazon is trying out AI automation at its warehouses. But the 12 million people in India's gig economy are oblivious of that. From millions of additions to the workforce to automation, India's gig economy is set for an upheaval. Will that be the end of the road for the millions who are always on the move but never move up?

Renuka Singh overwhelmed by villagers' tribute after India's World Cup triumph Indian pacer Renuka Thakur was overwhelmed after receiving a hero's welcome on Sunday upon her return to her ancestral village, Parsa, in the Rohru subdivision of Shimla district, following India's historic triumph at the 2025 ICC Women's World Cup.

Hockey player Julie Yadav dies after road accident in LucknowA young national-level athlete's life was cut short in a tragic road accident in Lucknow on Sunday. The death of 23-year-old sports teacher Julie Yadav has left her family and local sporting circles devastated.

Kranti Gaud's World Cup heroics help father reclaim Police job after 2012 setbackKranti Gaud's outstanding performance in the ICC Women's World Cup 2025 has led to her father's reinstatement in the police force. Kranti's father, Munna Singh Gaud, served as a constable in the police force before being dismissed in 2012, which pushed the family into financial turmoil.

Shafali Verma on year-long battle to claim World Cup glory: God rewarded my effortsShafali Verma's late call-up turned into a World Cup-defining masterclass as she powered India's historic title win. Her year of struggle, rebuilding and belief came together on the biggest night of her young career.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
